result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario J V Carranza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $50 per month. 2  day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario J V Carranza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mario J V Carranza in court with attorney David Saldana.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
  Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY- CT 2, CT 1-DRI
$200+cc+DNA, pp $50/mo beg 10/1/15 , ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.
Status conference on August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $800.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Mario J V Carranza in court with attorney David Saldana.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
